docs.abstract: Apple’s cloud service is intertwined with its operating systems, but you can move many of your files to a new online home.
docs.snippet: Apple’s cloud service is intertwined with its operating systems, but you can move many of your files to a new online home.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. How do I find something other than iCloud to save and back up my files?

docs.abstract: Apple’s iOS software includes a tool for planning a serious slumber schedule and sticking to it.
docs.snippet: Apple’s iOS software includes a tool for planning a serious slumber schedule and sticking to it.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. How does this Bedtime thing on the iPhone work? Does it automatically track your sleep?

docs.abstract: If you’re determined to enjoy time off without electronic interruption, set up an automatic reply message so your friends know you’re away.
docs.snippet: If you’re determined to enjoy time off without electronic interruption, set up an automatic reply message so your friends know you’re away.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. Can I set up a vacation bounce message in Gmail? If so, do those replies go to everyone, including spammers looking for live addresses?

headline.print_headline: How to Limit Your Automated Reply

docs.abstract: Windows Live Mail 2012 has been retired, but several other desktop programs can manage your inbox if you don’t want to wade in with a web browser.
docs.snippet: Windows Live Mail 2012 has been retired, but several other desktop programs can manage your inbox if you don’t want to wade in with a web browser.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. Microsoft stopped supporting Windows Live Mail 2012, and I’m looking for a replacement email program. I’ve tried Windows 10 Mail, Outlook, Gmail, AOL and a few others but find them lacking. Do you have any suggestions?

headline.print_headline: Use Third-Party Apps To Replace Live Mail

docs.abstract: The social media giant said a software glitch last month caused posts believed to be just for friends to become public.
docs.snippet: The social media giant said a software glitch last month caused posts believed to be just for friends to become public.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Facebook has been fighting for months the perception that it did not do enough to protect people’s privacy. On Thursday, the company said it had again failed to keep the information of millions of users private.

headline.main: Facebook Bug Changed Privacy Settings of Up to 14 Million Users
headline.print_headline: Facebook Bug Changed Privacy Settings of 14 Million

docs.abstract: If your browser is suddenly full of pop-up ads or taking you to sites you didn’t request, you probably have a malware infection.
docs.snippet: If your browser is suddenly full of pop-up ads or taking you to sites you didn’t request, you probably have a malware infection.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. I keep getting pop-ups in my browser search bar and sent to a site I’ve never heard of. What is this, a scam?

headline.main: Battling Adware That Redirects Your Browser

docs.abstract: A company vice president left earlier than planned after sharing a conspiracy theory on social media about the billionaire philanthropist’s being behind a migrant caravan in Mexico.
docs.snippet: A company vice president left earlier than planned after sharing a conspiracy theory on social media about the billionaire philanthropist’s being behind a migrant caravan in Mexico.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Campbell Soup Company executive who had planned to retire next month left last week instead after sharing a conspiracy theory on Twitter about a migrant caravan in Mexico, the company said on Monday.

headline.main: Campbell Soup and Executive ‘Accelerate’ His Exit After George Soros Tweet
headline.print_headline: Hasty Exit for Campbell Executive After Soros Tweet

docs.abstract: Masayoshi Son joins other prominent executives who have decided not to attend the investment conference over the killing of the journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
docs.snippet: Masayoshi Son joins other prominent executives who have decided not to attend the investment conference over the killing of the journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The chief executive of the SoftBank Group, Masayoshi Son, one of Saudi Arabia’s biggest business partners, has canceled his appearance at an investment conference in Riyadh, the latest fallout from the death of the journalist Jamal Khashoggi, a person briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

headline.main: SoftBank Chief Is Said to Have Canceled Appearance at Saudi Conference

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Amie Tsang

docs.abstract: Britain’s largest luxury label by sales had drawn sharp criticism for the practice, which the company justified as meant to protect its “brand value.”
docs.snippet: Britain’s largest luxury label by sales had drawn sharp criticism for the practice, which the company justified as meant to protect its “brand value.”
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When the British luxury label Burberry said this summer that it had burned tens of millions of dollars of unsold goods — an announcement that prompted fierce criticism — the practice was justified as an effort to maintain its “brand value.”

headline.main: Burberry to Stop Burning Clothing and Other Goods It Can’t Sell
headline.print_headline: After Backlash, Burberry Stops Burning Unsold Goods

docs.abstract: SiriusXM had already invested $480 million in Pandora, which has struggled to grow in the face of competition from Spotify and Apple.
docs.snippet: SiriusXM had already invested $480 million in Pandora, which has struggled to grow in the face of competition from Spotify and Apple.
docs.lead_paragraph: The satellite radio provider SiriusXM said on Monday that it would acquire the music streaming service Pandora Media for $3.5 billion, in a bid to corral listeners who don’t want to pay for premium channels.

headline.main: SiriusXM to Buy Pandora for $3.5 Billion in Bid to Expand Reach
headline.print_headline: SiriusXM, Expanding Its Reach, Will Buy Pandora

byline.original: By Amie Tsang and Edmund Lee
